}} The 'Enz' is a left tributary of the Neckar in Baden-WÃ¼rttemberg. It is
112 km long.

Its headstreams â the 'Little Enz' and the 'Big Enz' â rise in the northern
Black Forest, the latter at EnzklÃ¶sterle. In Calmbach (City of Bad Wildbad), the
Little Enz and the Big Enz join to form the Enz. The river passes through
NeuenbÃ¼rg and Pforzheim, where it leaves the Black Forest. It then flows through
the cities of Vaihingen and Bietigheim-Bissingen. Along the lower course, wine
is grown. Near Besigheim the Enz feeds into the Neckar.

In earlier times the Enz was important for floating timber.
